parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).
A myriad, group of ten thousand, a ten thousand. From murioi; a ten-thousand; by extension, a 'myriad' or indefinite number.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
One who is eagerly devoted to a person or a thing, a zealot. From zeloo; a 'zealot'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
